metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: AngularJS Services
In AngularJS you can make your own service, or use one of the many built-in services.
content.html: In AngularJS you can make your own service, or use one of the many built-in services.

content.text: What is a Service?
In AngularJS, a service is a function, or object, that is available for, and limited to, your AngularJS application.
content.html: In AngularJS, a service is a function, or object, that is available for, and limited to, your AngularJS application.

content.text: AngularJS has about 30 built-in services. One of them is the $location service.
content.html: AngularJS has about 30 built-in services. One of them is the $location service.

content.text: The $location service has methods which return information about the location of the current web page:
content.html: The $location service has methods which return information about the location of the current web page:

content.code_html:
var app = angular.module('myApp', []);
app.controller('customersCtrl', function($scope, $location) {
    $scope.myUrl = $location.absUrl();
});

content.text: Note that the $location service is passed in to the controller as an argument. In order to use the service in the controller, it must be defined as a dependency.
content.html: Note that the $location service is passed in to the controller as an argument. In order to use the service in the controller, it must be defined as a dependency.

content.text: Why use Services?

For many services, like the $location service, it seems like you could use objects that are already in the DOM, like the window.location object, and you could, but it would have some limitations, at least for your AngularJS application.
content.html: For many services, like the $location service, it seems like you could use objects that are already in the DOM, like the window.location object, and you could, but it would have some limitations, at least for your AngularJS application.

content.text: AngularJS constantly supervises your application, and for it to handle changes and events properly, AngularJS prefers that you use the $location service instead of the window.location object.
content.html: AngularJS constantly supervises your application, and for it to handle changes and events properly, AngularJS prefers that you use the $location service instead of the window.location object.

content.text: The $http Service
The $http service is one of the most common used services in AngularJS applications. The service makes a request to the server, and lets your application handle the response.
content.html: The $http service is one of the most common used services in AngularJS applications. The service makes a request to the server, and lets your application handle the response.

content.code_html:
var app = angular.module('myApp', []);
app.controller('myCtrl', function($scope, $http) {
  $http.get("welcome.htm").then(function (response) {
    $scope.myWelcome = response.data;
  });
});

content.text: This example demonstrates a very simple use of the $http service. Learn more about the $http service in the AngularJS Http Tutorial .
content.html: This example demonstrates a very simple use of the $http service. Learn more about the $http service in the AngularJS Http Tutorial.

content.text: The $timeout Service
The $timeout service is AngularJS' version of the window.setTimeout function.
content.html: The $timeout service is AngularJS' version of the window.setTimeout function.

content.code_html:
var app = angular.module('myApp', []);
app.controller('myCtrl', function($scope, $timeout) {
  $scope.myHeader = "Hello World!";
  $timeout(function () {
    $scope.myHeader = "How are you today?";
  }, 2000);
});

content.text: The $interval Service
The $interval service is AngularJS' version of the window.setInterval function.
content.html: The $interval service is AngularJS' version of the window.setInterval function.

content.code_html:
var app = angular.module('myApp', []);
app.controller('myCtrl', function($scope, $interval) {
  $scope.theTime = new Date().toLocaleTimeString();
  $interval(function () {
    $scope.theTime = new Date().toLocaleTimeString();
  }, 1000);
});

content.text: Create Your Own Service
To create your own service, connect your service to the module:
content.html: To create your own service, connect your service to the module:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
app.service('hexafy', function() {  this.myFunc = function (x) {    
    return x.toString(16);  }});

content.code:
app.service('hexafy', function() {  this.myFunc = function (x) {
return x.toString(16);  }});

syntax_highlighting.text:
app.service('hexafy', function() {  this.myFunc = function (x) {    
 return x.toString(16);  }});

content.code_html:
app.service('hexafy', function() {
  this.myFunc = function (x) {
    return x.toString(16);
  }
});

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
app.service('hexafy', function() {  this.myFunc = function (x) {    
    return x.toString(16);  }});

content.text: To use your custom made service, add it as a dependency when defining the controller:
content.html: To use your custom made service, add it as a dependency when defining the controller:

content.code_html:
app.controller('myCtrl', function($scope, hexafy) {
  $scope.hex = hexafy.myFunc(255);
});

content.text: Use a Custom Service Inside a Filter
Once you have created a service, and connected it to your application, you can use the service in any controller, directive, filter, or even inside other services.
content.html: Once you have created a service, and connected it to your application, you can use the service in any controller, directive, filter, or even inside other services.

content.text: To use the service inside a filter, add it as a dependency when defining the filter:
content.html: To use the service inside a filter, add it as a dependency when defining the filter:

content.code_html:
app.filter('myFormat',['hexafy', function(hexafy) {
  return function(x) {
    return hexafy.myFunc(x);
  };
}]);

content.text: You can use the filter when displaying values from an object, or an array:
content.html: You can use the filter when displaying values from an object, or an array:

content.code_html:
<ul>
  <li ng-repeat="x in counts">{{x | myFormat}}</li>
</ul>
